New Records: Bailey Ober surrendered a career-worst nine earned runs in two innings.
Key Match Events: Atlanta Braves opened a three-game series by sending the Twins to a 10-6 loss
The Twins tried to rally and made a decent dent, but it came far too late.
Byron Buxton update: Baldelli hinted before the game that Byron Buxton could be nearing the start of a rehab assignment.
Pre-Game Insights: Baldelli suggested the club’s overworked bullpen could use a typical Ober outing where the righty pitches deep into the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Ober said he was ‘pretty angry’ after the game and was trying to go over the outing in his head as much as he can and see if he could have done anything different.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A rainbow even appeared over the left-field scoreboard during the storm.
The delay lasted 86 minutes and ended Ober’s night.
Others: The Twins actually gained ground on two of the three teams nearest to them in the American League playoff picture.
The Royals’ doubleheader sweep of first-place Cleveland moved the Twins within 2 1/2 of first place.
